private_information: I manage the left peg and currently hold disks from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F
I can accept or give a single disk at a time
left_peg.goal: Contribute to moving the entire stack from the left peg to the right peg following the rules.

private_information: I manage the middle peg and currently hold no disks
I can accept or give a single disk at a time
middle_peg.goal: Serve as an auxiliary peg to help move the stack from the left peg to the right peg.

private_information: I manage the right peg and currently hold no disks
I can accept or give a single disk at a time
right_peg.goal: Receive the full stack from the left peg so that final configuration is achieved.

private_information: I coordinate the peg agents and must assemble their reports into a global PDDL planning problem
The final PDDL must be compatible with the FastDownwards solver
orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and problem that solve the Tower of Hanoi instance and are tailored for FastDownwards.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are six disks labeled A (smallest) through F (largest).
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has disks from top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F; middle and right are empty.
Goal configuration: right peg has disks from top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F; left and middle are empty.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and in producing PDDL files suitable for the FastDownwards solver. Your job is to take the peg state reports and assemble a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models the Tower of Hanoi instance for FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep all agent roles and move actions explicit and ensure the encoding enforces single-disk moves and the rule that no larger disk may be placed on a smaller disk.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Use the environment public information: {environment->public_information} and the local reports from the peg agents: {state_left} {state_middle} {state_right} and the orchestrator private information: {agents->orchestrator->private_information} Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that represent the Tower of Hanoi with pegs left, middle, right and disks A..F. The PDDL must be directly usable by the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Do not include extraneous commentary.
